articles.author: RFI
articles.title: Risk of monkeypox spreading widely 'very low' - RFI English
articles.description: The risk of monkeypox spreading widely among the general population is very low and transmission can be stopped outside endemic countries in Central and West Africa, health officials said Monday, after cases exploded this month in Europe and North America.
articles.content: Stockholm (AFP) The risk of monkeypox spreading widely among the general population is very low and transmission can be stopped outside endemic countries in Central and West Africa, health officials … [+2510 chars]

articles.title: Lagarde Signals End to ECB’s Negative Interest Rates Experiment - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: The European Central Bank is likely to increase its key interest rate to zero or above by September, President Christine Lagarde said, echoing robust moves by the Federal Reserve and other major central banks to phase out easy-money policies as inflation heat…
articles.content: FRANKFURTThe European Central Bank is likely to increase its key interest rate, currently negative, to zero by September and could continue raising rates after that, President Christine Lagarde said,… [+525 chars]

articles.author: Eilish O'Regan
articles.title: Up to 85 monkeypox cases detected in EU countries as disease watchdog calls for vigilance - Independent.ie
articles.description: Public health authorities in EU countries, including Ireland, need to remain vigilant for cases of monkeypox with 85 infections now reported in the region, Europe’s disease watchdog warned today.
articles.content:

articles.author: Tomas Doherty
articles.title: Spread of monkeypox in Europe is a ‘scientific mystery’, says Luke O'Neill - BreakingNews.ie
articles.description: The recent outbreak in more than 10 countries where it is not endemic is highly unusual
articles.content:
The monkeypox outbreak in Europe is a "scientific mystery" as the source of many infections remains unknown, immunologist Prof Luke O'Neill has said.

articles.author: Maria Cheng
articles.title: Expert: Monkeypox likely spread by sex at 2 raves in Europe - The Associated Press
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — A leading adviser to the World Health Organization described the unprecedented outbreak of monkeypox  in developed countries as “a random event” that might be explained by sexual behavior at two recent raves in Europe.

articles.title: Explainer: How concerned should we be about monkeypox? - CNA
articles.description:
NEW YORK: Global health officials have sounded the alarm over rising cases in Europe and elsewhere of monkeypox, a type of viral infection more common to west and central Africa.
